comment: This class was an easy A as long as you put in the work for it. Yes, you'll have blogs to write and some papers but none of them are very long or hard to do. She's also very nice and an excellent communicator. I'd take a class with her again if I could.

Took her class online. Super easy. I have a 98 right now. She's an easy grader. Short papers and no test. Quizzes on the textbook readings, but you can just look at the book while taking the quiz and you'll get a 100. I hate online textbooks, but I got it online from Chegg and it was worth it. TAKE HER!

I'm not a fan of literature but she made me interested in it. She really knows her stuff but isn't one of those professors who expects you to know everything as well. She's actually really funny and interesting to listen to.

Took this class online.  Yes, online classes are more work.  That's because you're not sitting in the classroom.  This one is as good as it gets.  Clear assignments. SHORT papers (750 words).  There's a blog but not every week.  Professor grades super fast and answers e-mails super fast.
Entirely too much work. Lowest grade I've received  in my entire college career, despite all the work that I put in. I wish I had dropped this class.

took online class; a heavy work load each week.  you usually have a blog, a discussion, and a short paper, plus a book quiz EACH week.  Not that hard, but extremely time consuming.  she expects about 13 hours of homework each week for her class.

No test just wrote papers, but writing prompts were easy. There is one or two group projects where you present but she's such a casual grader. Class almost always got out early and she had work days where you could stay home and work all day on papers. Theres usually a rubric and its super clear. She's also hilarious and sarcastic, loved the class!
Simple papers. Those papers are your only grades. Overall excellent teacher!

She tells you what she wants and expects of you and she is very clear about it. If you want an A you will get it with a little work. The only grades are participation and the 4 papers. I highly recommend taking Mrs. Bourdeau.

LOVE HER! I took her for English Comp 1 and for English Comp 2. For English Comp 2, if you do the essays, you should not have a problem with getting an A! Also, she gives correction logs and you get 5 extra points per an essay for them! TAKE HER! She is also very sarcastic-funny! -K

Such a funny and easy professor! You honestly don't have to read the stories, just sparknotes them. Class is not mandatory, but the lectures sure help for the test. She basically describes all the stories.
Very nice professor! Only four essays and class work! I love her! Taking her again next semester!

Great class, easy class, nice teacher. 3 test with one small project. She goes off topic for probably 30 minutes each class. Not a bad thing at all because they are funny stories. Post power points online and test are pretty easy with extra credit. Take her, she's awesome.
Professor actually cares about her students. She probably doesn't know this but she helped me through a rough time last semester.  Great teacher.  Great person.

You read a lot of books in this class.  I actually thought about dropping this course based on the textbook list.  I'm so glad I didn't.  The reading was great.  She goes over all of the material very well.  Good sense of humor.  Seems to really care about her job and the students.  I loved this class.
Very easy to understand. She has easy assignments and your papers are short and to the point. Easy A. But she grades kind of tough, but she will not fail you.

Great personality, very clear in her teaching style. Uses a lot of powerpoints. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you'll highly benefit by going to class. If not, you will miss a lot of important information for tests. Great class.
Super Easy! As long as you go to class and hear what quotes she talks about you will get an A. Spark Notes work if you want to skip reading the material.
Attend class and take good notes, should be all you need for an A

Super easy! I made a 100 in the class, granted I read majority of the reading in high school, but I never read during her class- sparknotes will be your new best friend. She is funny and gives extra credit on test and does test review! TAKE HER!

This was a very easy class. You only have 3 essays the whole semester. On essay days they are class optional. We never really used the book. No test or quizzes. She grades a little tough but not that bad. If you just do your work you can make at least a B.

Def a teacher you want to have if you're not interested in Eng major. She makes it simple and easy to understand whats going on. as long as you attend class you will get through with at A. Never read anything from the books,pure power points and listening in class and i raped the class. MUST TAKE!

Attendance not mandatory. Although she does mention quotes from the readings in her lectures that are not online. If you have a good general idea of the stories; theme, genre, characters, allegory, etc you will do well. no need to read, just read the summary/analysis on the internet using a search engine.

Best teacher ever. She is hilarious and knows her material. Rambles and tells funny stories about her life, but normally still lets the class out extremely early. Plenty of extra credit opportunity. Everything you need for the 3 tests (no papers) are on the power points and she'll tell you exactly what to study. Take her. Easy A. And she's awesome.

Love this Teacher. She is hilarious. gives extra credit. online discussions before tests. Interesting class. i looked forward to this class. she keeps it fun and light. you need to review the literature but go by her slides and lectures and you will be fine. Really gonna miss this class and teacher

she is a very nice teacher, very easy, she revises your essays and gives you advice before you turn them in. Didnt use the writer's reference book, which is required for 1101, but it helps if you're REALLY stuck..she rambles some, but it's alright 3 essays total and the last one is the final def. recommended!

My favorite teacher so far. She goes over you're papers and tells you how to improve them before the final draft. Rarely do we have class because she gives us work days for our papers. However, she remains in class for those who want to work at school and get help from her. Highly recomend!

So very nice, and very comedic. Will ramble at times, but who doesn't? Very large class, 200-ish, but the material is easy. Online Discussions for help, and 3 tests make up the grade with plenty of opportunities and styles to gather points. I'mma miss her class!

Phenomenal teacher. Very interesting. You should definitely read the books, but I mean, hello it is about literature. Lectures are very interesting, attendance isn't mandatory, but you want to go to class. She is hilarious

Dr. B is fantastic. You DO have to read the material in order to do well on her exams but she does basically outline every main idea thoroughly in her powerpoints. She makes it interesting and as minimally painful as a World Lit. class can be.

She is a fantastic teacher and makes the class a laid back environment. Tests are all writing so pay attention. Just be sure to come to class and do a decent review of material. Class is easy and pretty interesting.
She was the best I have a very hard time writing and I got an A.
Horror stories and film as subject matter for analysis. OK if you have  stong stomach.

If you come to class, pay attention, and take good notes (listen for quotes, significant characters, and genres), you pretty much don't even need to read anything. I got all A's on the tests without breaking a sweat.

To do well in this class you really need to attend as much as you can(particularly if you didn't read the assignment0, but she doesn't take attendance.  Test's are short answer and if you pay attention are real easy.  A must take class if you have a full-time job!!!!

Very easy and goes over pretty much everything in class. I hardly read any of the books and got above a 94 on every test and more than a hundred on one(she has extra credit on tests). Highly Recommended. Quirky/ cliche jokes but chuckles are appreciated. Loves Reeces candy. ;)

She is a great professor. She's funny & down to earth. Very informative & clear about what the class entails. There are only 3 test grades, so if you have a full-time job & don't like busy work it's great! You have to read to do well, b/c the tests are not multiple choice. I've gotten 2 out of 3 A's so far, so if you study you'll do well.
Best class i've had at KSU so far! Very funny and keeps the class interesting. Posts the powerpoints online and as long as you take a look at stories you'll get an easy A.
Great teacher! She knows the material that she is teaching really well and makes her lectures interesting. Go to class, take notes & read the books and you will pass all of the tests with an A.

One of the best professors at Kennesaw. No papers required, funny, engaging, and helpful. Yes, you read Conrad's "Heart of Darkness", but she actually makes it enjoyable. Pre-test chat Q&A sessions make studying easy, and the tests are designed to help you succeed. It's nice to have a professor who's actually -gasp- a human being.
Definitely take this teacher! Super nice and tells you exactly what's going to be on the test. Doesn't take attendance either. I recommend her!

I have Dr. Bordeau for a large 2110 section.  Even though it is in a lecture hall she still keeps me interested.  Funny teacher, down to earth.  I was dreading this class but it has been a great experience and one of the best classes I've ever had.

Took ENGL 2174 this summer with Dr. Bourdeau, and I really enjoyed the class.  She keeps is really interesting and encourages everyone to contribute. The readings were great, even the ones I didn't think I would like.  One of the best English professors at KSU.  Her classes tend to fill up fast.

Took her in the summer and didn't really feel like I got much out of it.  There were only three grades (2 exams and a paper).  During both exams she does quotes/short-answer and hand-written essays.  Don't take her if you struggle writing five paragraph essays during  one hour exams in the fall/spring semesters and two hours in the summer.
Wonderful professor. Very engaging and humorous.

If you like a fast-paced discussion class where the instructor tries to actually get you to think and talk about the readings, you will love her.  If want your profs to treat you like a brain dead zombie who can't think for yourself, try someone else.  I loved this course.  If she taught "Literature You'll Hate 1101," I'd take it.

One of the best English classes I've had in my years at KSU. The texts are well chosen and opens the floor to much discussion. Interesting, funny, lots of fun, and you still learn a lot! One short essay, one longer essay, midterm, and a final. She prepares you well for the exams: choose 2 out of 4, and you'll love her questions!

I will never take this professor again. Class was horribly boring and she only talked to the people in the front of the room. Had no structure, just did whatever she wanted. Gave no guidelines for the papers, just expected us to know what to write.

This was my favorite class this semester.  Dr. B. really involved the students in discussion and made us think.  I enjoyed the books and looked forward to this class.  She has a fantastic personality and a great attitude.
Very nice prof. Wants her students to do well and to learn the art of writing well. Fun class.
This Prof is great! talks a lot (sometimes to herself) and always laughs at herself. If you want an A, take her! only three essays in the class. If I could take her again, I would.
She is awesome and is a very good teacher. Very lenient, very cool.
LOVED HER!  Best Lit professor at KSU.  She's passionate, funny, and brilliant.  She picks out great works for reading assignments.  Tests are essay style so as long as you read, you'll do great.
Excellent professor, very funny and friendly.
She is a nice teacher. Just 3 major eases and extra point for peer review!!.

Mrs. Bourdeau was my favorite professor this semester. She is a very nice person. She grades rather easily. If there is a problem with your essays she will help you work them out. She is funny and easy going. She doesn't get mad if you are late. DEFINITELY TAKE HER CLASS!!!!

She is definitely one of the best at KSU! only 3 major essays and I really learned a lot from her class. She will look over your essays before you turn it in and give you advice on how to improve your paper. All you have to do is try your best and do all assignments and you should do well.

Nice lady. There are 3 major essays, plus grades for peer reviews, easy reading quizes and practice regents tests. If you are a decent writer, you'll do well. She's very helpful, giving specifics where needed. I wish I could have her for Eng1102. One of the best at KSU!
Laid back and funny, essays were enjoyable and class was fun. Highly recommended though she will spoil you for other english professors.
Easiest teacher ever!!! Very little work involved and the essays are very easy. Only problem is there are only 3 major grades so if you mess up even one your screwed.
A really great teacher, who doesn't penalize for stupid things like MLA format! Take her!

Best teacher I have had ever...Very helpful in her lectures and the lectures are interesting.  She tells you what is going to be on the test and lets you ask detailed questions about what is on the test.  Her stories about her life outside of class are a gag and she should be a comedian.  I loved her and her class.

The best professor i have ever had!! She is the best at Kennesaw. She really enjoys what she does, I hated English..and she has opened up a new way of thinking for me...i loved her i would take more classes with her

Awesome teacher!  My favorite class!  Her paper subjects are great and make writing them so much more fun.  She's a funny teacher that definitely tries to relate to the students with jokes.  Overall great teacher!!

Excellent instructor. Loves what she does. Essay and short answer tests. Reading the material and paying attention is imperitive. Tells you what she's looking fon the tests. She is laid back, but show some respect and arrive on time. That helps her mood. Gets visibly frustrated when people drift in late and disturb the flow of the class.

Professor Bourdeau is wonderful. She loves teaching World Lit and she loves to talk! She goes over all reading assignments so attendance is a MUST since her tests are basically what she reviews. She can be moody and a bit **** but don't let that keep you from taking her. You can easily make an A in this class.
Debra is the best professor I have ever had. I would take her again if I needed to. Read and come to class if you want an A. She made a Saturday class one of my best! AMAZING!
Debra is awesome! I hate reading but she made it really fun. I hated the time theough (9:30-10:45pm) but she is worth it if you are not good at reading.

An absolutely hilarious teacher whose personality rubs off onto the students, making the whole class period very fun and relieving the monotony that is English.  She encourages discussion and chooses interesting books to read.
she is a very good and wonderful teacher, i enjoyed her so much that my husband and i took her again. i took all my english classes with her. she's awesome!

Kept course focused and relevant to the course's purpose. Because this is a COMPOSITION course, she graded on ability to write a clear, well-formed paper as opposed to content. Easy A, but you'll learn a good amount about writing well-structured papers.
